page.title: 02THE VILLAGE,WINSTONE
page.content: Winstone has a population of 228,18% are under 16 and 22% are of pensionable age .The village is set on a slight hill just 6 miles from Cirencester.It has a combination of old and new houses as well as Fossfields which are Council houses , built since 1950.Some of the newer houses are very modern designs which seem out of character with the stone cottages in the centre.The village name has 3 possible derivations : perhaps a battle was fought and won here,it could have been a Saxon Hamlet whose chief was Wynn or,as some villagers believe,the village was the home of Belgian Refugees who made wine.About 100yards East of the village is the old Manor Farm where local people say the village began.Across the field are two beautiful barns,both listed buildings.
